item.content:encoded:
Source: https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/goldenenchants-%E2%80%A2-more-vanilla-like-enchantments-1-14-1-16.61693/

We use this as a dependency / Engine for Golden Crates, the plugin which powers our crate system.

There is no content for this dependency so it’s child plugin will be displayed below:

Â Â 
This plugin adds more thanÂ 40 vanilla-like enchantsÂ on your server! They’re fully customizable, support anvils, enchanted books and enchantment tables! Just like the vanilla enchants!


Â Â 


Â Â 

List of Enchantments
â€‹

â€¢Â Max. Compatibility:

â–¸ Enchants are properly registered, which allows you to use them in other plugins!
â–¸ Mobs with items enchanted with golden enchantments will have effect!
â–¸ 100% Support forÂ Anvils!
â–¸ 100% Support forÂ Grindstones!â€‹

â€¢Â Enchantment Table Support:

â–¸ You can easily obtain new enchantments on vanilla enchantment table!
â–¸ Define the chance of obtain custom enchantment on enchantment table.
â–¸ Define the max. amount of custom enchantments that can be applied on item per one enchantment.
â–¸ Enchanting books is also supported!â€‹

â€¢Â Anvil support:

â–¸ Custom enchantments perfectly works for vanilla anvils! Merge item enchants, enchant item with a book, it will work!
â–¸ Custom enchanment levels are sums like vanilla!
â–¸ Anvil exp cost is increasing for each custom enchantment level!â€‹

â€¢Â Villagers support:

â–¸ Enable/Disable Golden Enchants population for villager trades.
â–¸ Define the global chance to trigger Golden Enchants population.
â–¸ Define the population chance for each enchantment!
â–¸ Define the min. and max. amount of golden enchants to be generated per one item in a trade.â€‹

â€¢Â Loot Generation support:

â–¸ Enable/Disable Golden Enchants population for chests and minecarts in freshly generated chunks.
â–¸ Define the global chance to trigger Golden Enchants population.
â–¸ Define the population chance for each enchantment!
â–¸ Define the min. and max. amount of golden enchants to be generated per one item in a chest/minecart.â€‹

â€¢Â Item Options:

â–¸ An option to enable/disable applying sword enchatments on axes.
â–¸ An option to enable/disable applying bow enchantments on crossbows.
â–¸ An option to define max. possible amount of custom enchantments for an item.â€‹

â€¢Â Enchant Configuration:

â–¸ You can disable any enchantment you don’t like!
â–¸ All enchantment options are configurable!
â–¸ Enchantment names are configurable.
â–¸ Define min. and max. levels for each enchantment!
â–¸ Define enchant chance for each enchantment!
â–¸ Configurable chance of enchantment trigger.
â–¸ Configurable enchantment formulas and effects!â€‹

â€¢Â Visual Effects:

â–¸ Most of enchantments comes with particle effects and sounds!
â–¸ These effects are also configurable!â€‹

â€¢Â Enchant Tiers:

â–¸ Create custom enchantment tiers to split enchantments by its rarity.
â–¸ Define the tier name and color to display it in item lore.
â–¸ Define the chance to obtain enchant of this tier.â€‹

 

â€‹

â–¸Â /ge [help]Â – List of plugin sub-commands.
â–¸Â /ge list [page]Â – List of all enchantments.
â–¸Â /ge enchant <enchantment> <level>Â – (Dis)Enchant item in hand.
â–¸Â /ge book <player> <enchantment> <level>Â – Give an enchanted book.
â–¸Â /ge tierbook <player> <tier> <level>Â – Give an enchanted book with random tier enchantment.
â–¸Â /ge reloadÂ – Reload the plugin.

â€‹

â–¸Â goldenenchants.userÂ – User access (useless atm).
â–¸Â goldenenchants.adminÂ – Admin access.

âœ—Â No data about compatibility with other custom enchantment plugins. If you have any, use it on your own risk.
